p: Recombineering was performed as previously described [ 46] with some modifications. For heat-inducible homologous recombination in SW102 E. coli, containing the BAC-BoHV-4-A-TK-KanaGalK-TK genome targeted into the TK locus with KanaGalK selector cassette, the PvuI linearized pTK-CMV-NiV-F-TK or pTK-CMV-NiV-G-TK expression cassettes were used. After recombineering, only those colonies that were kanamycin resistant and chloramphenicol positive were isolated and grown overnight in 5 mL of LB containing 12.5 mg/mL of chloramphenicol. BAC-DNA was purified and analyzed through HindIII restriction enzyme digestion. DNA was separated by electrophoresis in a 1% agarose gel. Original detailed protocols for recombineering can also be found at the recombineering website ( https://redrecombineering.ncifcrf.gov/).
